title: Can the Armenia-Azerbaijani standoff be finally resolved diplomatically or only on the battlefield? - Quora

response.answer_text: Diplomatic resolution requires bilateral will to resolve the issue. It is only the war that can be launched unilaterally. As regards the Armenian-Azerbaijani negotiations on Nagorno-Karabakh (Artsakh) conflict under the mediation of OESC Minsk Group, any room for the diplomatic resolution of conflict thereunder is exhausted now because of: The Azerbaijani ultimatum-like stands on every discussed issue and the Azerbaijani threat by war turned into the only Azerbaijani “argument” in the negotiations, being feeded by the Turkish military adventurism & abundant military supplies to Azerbaijan by Russia, Turkey & Israel;Failure of mediators, namely Russia, USA, and France, to ensure their own claims on non-acceptability of military resolution of conflict with any real efforts to enforce the peace to the Azerbaijani warmonger.On 27.09.2020, Azerbaijan & Turkey launched a full-sized military aggression against Artsakh & Armenia to “resolve” the conflict by extermination of indigenous people of Artsakh and military occupation of Artsakh territory. Thereby Azerbaijan violated the negotiation premises and practically ceased from the negotiations for diplomatic resolution of conflict. On 21.10.2020, after total failure of mediators to stop and punish the Azerbaijani aggressor who violated the mediators’ claim on non-acceptability of military resolution, Armenia officially ceased from the negotiations, their premises and pre-agreements. It is expected that Armenia will recognize the Republic of Artsakh in the coming days. I.e., next negotiations, if any, will be launched with a clean slate and under the new reality: Artsakh independence & sovereignty is a fact and no more subject to negotiations, and Artsakh government shall be the major side of any negotiations related to Artsakh. From my perspective, one of the major reasons of failure of the diplomatic resolution was the excessive internationalization of the negotiations involving lots of diverse mediators & influencers with contradicting intentions, who rather promoted own interests than contributed to the negotiations. To be successful, any negotiation shall immediately involve the conflicting parties with the mediation of minimum number of mediators capable to enforce peaceful resolution and counteract the third-parties’ interferences into the negotiations.

Yes, there is only one diplomatic solution to Karabakh conflict and it is Armenian military troops` withdrawing unconditionally and immediately from the territories of Azerbaijan Karabakh. Karabakh is internationally recognized under Azerbaijan territorial integrity by 194 countries including Armenia itself. Armenian occupation of Karabakh is the breach of International Law by violating territorial integrity of a sovereign state, of Azerbaijan. At this point, the only solution to end war and stop human life losses is the withdrawal of Armenian troops from Azerbaijan`s territories. To end Armenian occupation of Azerbaijan. Azerbaijan is implementing four UN Security Council Resolutions on Karabakh by counterattacks against foreign invaders of Karabakh and returning back over a million ethnical Azeri IDPs and refugees of Karabakh to their homes. 1993 UN Security Council Resolutions on Nagorno-Karabakh

A2A. It couldn’t be resolved diplomatically for the past 30 years. The no-passing point was a notion of which countries to be peacekeepers. Armenia wanted Russia, Azerbaijan also wanted Turkey. Armenia wouldn’t agree on that, despite the fact that Turkey has many citizens of Armenian origin, some are very successful, including celebrities and Parliament members, and migrating workers from Armenia that come to Turkey for work and send remittances back to Armenia. Now that the military solution is taking place, and the Azerbaijani side is making a significant progress, it would not be interested in negotiations, for as long as it is making progress and likely regaining all the occupied lands back. There’s a possible scenario where Russia will “force” everyone to the negotiations table, but if it comes to that, Azerbaijani side will have a leverage and get all of its original conditions, including Turkish peacemakers’ presence.

The question would be how such a diplomatic solution would look like: Artsakh/Karabakh could become a part of Armenia (together with a sort of corridor between Mainland-Armenia and Artsakh/Karabakh). This solution is opposed vehemently by Azerbaijan and it would be - if not supported by Azerbaijan - very problematic with regard to international law.Artsakh/Karabakh could be returned unconditionally to Azerbaijan. This solution is rejected categorically by Armenia, because the population is (and was) overwhelmingly Armenian and it would be highly problematic with regard to human rights, because Azerbaijan is a chauvinist-nationalist dictatorship and there a no signs that will be protection for that big Armenian minority under Azerbaijan rule.Artsakh/Karabakh could be become an “ålandised territory” in Azerbaijan (Åland). That means that Artsakh/Karabakh would have absolut and unquestioned cultural autonomy, supervised by CoE and/or OSCE.So, the “solutions” 1. and 2. would not work, the international community should work towards the third solution - no matter whether Alijev and Erdogan like it or not.
